result.execSummary:
The defendant Tony Lee Bowman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony Lee Bowman

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court.  Attorney Kathleen Robin Avoles appeared by phone means.  PO Agent, Sara Lazarz appears by phone means.  Court wanted hearing to see how defendant is doing on probation.  Court informed by defendant things are going well, confirmed by PO agent.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge advises defendant of charges/max penalties of Count 1 in 15CF31, and confirms defendant waives right to PH in 15CF46 and binds defendant over.  State files Information in 15CF46.  Court advised defendant of charge/max. penalties and constitutional rights, felony prohibitions.  Defendant enters plea of no contest to Count 1 in 15CF31 and no contest to bail jumping in 15CF46.  Plea colloquy. Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done knowingly & voluntarily, accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty, order PSI.  DRI counts 2,3,4 in 15CF31.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives time limits for P.H.  Referred to scheduling clerk.
Bakke Norman, S.C. mailed a copy of the annexed Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection on 09/29/2015 to Clerk of Circuit court and District Attorney.
Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Tony Lee Bowman in court with attorney Kathleen R. Avoles.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charge/max. penalties, constitutional rights, and right to preliminary hearing.  Court reminds defendant of other charges of burglary with dangerous weapon and possesion of burglarious tools.  State requests $5000 cash bond as that was our request on other case which was changed to signature bond.  Atty Avoles requests the surety bond from initial case be carried over to this case as well,  Eau Claire case has addt'l safe guards, no need for cash bond, suggest we revisit it when we visit the motion to revoke bond on the other case.  Court imposes $5000 cash bond on both cases, surety no longer liable.  Court will address the motion for judgment against surety at the next hearing.  Defendant waives time limits for PH on this case.
